review: I love it, but am disappointed that you still have to pay for some things or that some channels still require a cable provider to watch. Why should I pay a yearly fee for a service that I could easily watch with my cable provider? There is no incentive to keep it past the free trial period. I do like the convience of it but directv go enables me to watch things anywhere too. Why pay for this service and cable. I would pay for the fire stick if I didn't have to still be subscribed to cable to watch certain channels
author: Marcus Hoey

review: My review is not on the Firestick other then to alert certain Comcast customers who have the Xfinity X1 System that the Firestick may not bE compatible with their modem/voice/router combination. I have the SMC and it doesn't work. I believe Amazon is negligent in not alerting us to this fact.  The Fire Stick, in all probability is an outstanding product from all the favorable reviews, but not when it won't work with your system.
author: JACKR

review: I received it ahead of schedule which is always a plus!  Everything works good and seems pretty smooth.  There is a power adapter that is required to be plugged into the stick that I was unaware of, but not a deal breaker.  For their first swing at a stick version of FireTV, its a great start.
author: Orion6192 "Orion6192"

review: I have had the FTVS for 2 weeks now it is glitchy with Netflix and with Cracke. my prime membership expiered and I have not tried it on amazon prime video. will upgrade review when they come up wit an update for Netflix glitchyness.
author: Robert Duran

review: So far: its alright.I plugged it into my projector, does what it says it will.Con: I plugged it in and used it last night, afterward I couldn't find any way to turn it off so I just turned off the projector, fine. When I turned on the projector today it was on "resetting to factory defaults" - apparently I or my cat had bumped the buttons on it while the projector was off. So I had to go through set-up again. You can't forward through or skip the welcome to Fire Stick video.I don't want to have to climb up and unplug it to turn it off,  it needs to either go to sleep eventually or have an off option (let me know if I just failed to see it). It would suck  to have to deal with it resetting or worse, things getting purchased, just because it can't turn off and the buttons press easily.Also: I was excited about the 'fling to second screen' capability ... before realizing that is only designed to work with Fire phones and tablets. I'm pretty sure it could work with an Android app, maybe with a slight delay, I'm just not willing to buy a fire phone or tablet just for that... but if it had that for android I would buy into my own prime account (I'm on a family prime account, and I'm not the primary so I don't get video, I'm mostly using this for netflix and the occasional video rental).
author: Elissa

review: Just received the Fire TV stick today.  So far, it is wonderful.  Very easy to set up and has lots of categories from movies, to games and apps and many more functions.  My TV in my craft room is not hooked to cable so I was only able to get the standard stations but with this,,I have so many options.  Your TV must have an HDMI port to be able to use.
author: Marsha

review: I love my Fire TV Stick! It's small and conveniently hidden behind the TV but still very powerful. Videos start very quickly and play smoothly. Setup was a breeze. I definitely recommend these over other streaming players on the market.
author: Amazon Customer

review: Works well, my first foray into the Android ecosystem.  Was concerned about wifi bandwidth since my TV is upstairs and router is downstairs, but have not had any issues.  Enjoy the access to Hulu, Netflix, Amazon Prime Video, and ability to sideload XBMC to stream content from my NAS.
author: Wallace Printz

review: I am LOVE The Fire Stick, you really need to take the time to go through all of the apps and such, but it is such a great tool and is saving me a TON ov money!It's cool
